description.narrative: IFC proposes to make an equity investment of up to approximately 5 million, not to exceed 20% of total commitments in Fonds Cauris Croissance II (Cauris II). IFC will be considered a subsequent investor contributing capital after first closing of the fund. Cauris II is a private equity fund which will make equity and quasi-equity investments in small and medium enterprise (SME) companies in West Africa, primarily West African Economic Monetary Union (WAEMU) countries including Benin, Burkina Faso, Cote dIvoire, Guinea Bissau, Mali, Niger, Senegal, and Togo. The Fund has a committed capital target size of up to 60 million.

The Fund will achieve development impact by increasing access to financing for small and mid-sized companies in Francophone West Africa which are largely ignored by the larger funds; investing in frontier markets such as Benin, Burkina Faso, Guinea, Mali, Niger and Togo, supporting a local emerging Fund Manager in the region; investing in growth companies of a local emerging Fund Manager in the region; providing hands-on monitoring and guidance to the management of SME companies through board/management participation; sharing environmental and social international best practices with a local SME Fund Manager. The investment is expected to create above average employment and accelerate economic growth across the region. The investment will be across a diversity of sectors. The Fund's investment in target companies will range from Euro 2-4.5 million and will consist mainly of strategic minority stakes, with board representation and shareholder right to influence the strategic direction of the company and conduct of management.
